description: Cal Burke scored three times, and Cale Morris made 39 saves as No. 4 Notre Dame completed its first sweep in Madison in 14 tries with a 6-2 victory over the University of Wisconsin men's hockey...
title: Notre Dame 6, Wisconsin 2
title_page: Badgers men's hockey gameday: Notre Dame 6, Wisconsin 2
maintext:
Cal Burke scored three times, and Cale Morris made 39 saves as No. 4 Notre Dame completed its first sweep in Madison in 14 tries with a 6-2 victory over the University of Wisconsin men’s hockey team on Saturday at the Kohl Center. Game story
Three stars
No. 3: Defenseman Dennis Gilbert, who had one goal this season and three in 95 collegiate games, scored twice for Notre Dame.
No. 2: Cale Morris was solid in net for the Fighting Irish, making 17 of his 39 saves in the third period.
No. 1: Cal Burke continued a breakout sophomore season with goals 10, 11 and 12 for Notre Dame.
Up next
The Badgers are off for the next three weekends before opening the second half at Penn State on Jan. 5 and 6.
Pregame
After allowing a two-goal lead to turn into a loss for the first time in 132 chances on Friday, the 12th-ranked University of Wisconsin men’s hockey team has changes in the lineup for Saturday’s rematch against No. 4 Notre Dame (7 p.m., FSW+, 1310 AM).
Kyle Hayton will start in goal on Saturday after Jack Berry allowed three goals on eight shots in the third period of Friday’s 3-2 loss.
The whole fourth line has been changed, with UW listing Matt Ustaski and Jason Ford in that group and Cullen Hurley as a seventh defenseman.
On Friday, the Badgers lost after holding a lead of at least two goals in the third period for the first time since Jan. 3, 2009, against Northern Michigan. UW was 126-0-5 in those situations since then.
